moves.1. d4: I wanted to show this game as it demonstrates an unjustified sacrifice.
moves.1... Nf6 2. c4 e6 3. Nc3 Bb4 4. a3 Bxc3+: My favorite variation. It immediately attacks the center and I have a fetish for c-pawn moves in the opening.
moves.6. Nf3 O-O 7. e3 d6: d5 is another option, but at this time, I did not want to exchange my d-pawn for the c-pawn.
moves.8. Bd3 Nc6 9. O-O e5: Inviting to close off the center with d5 with a permanent doubled pawn, or for the center to be broken up.
moves.10. Nd2: White's black-squared bishop does not have much chance for mobility. Maybe the idea of a4, Ba3 would be good. Instead, white sacrifices a pawn for activity.
moves.10... cxd4 11. cxd4 exd4 12. Bb2 dxe3 13: The issue is that I get good activity as well. Now, the c-pawn is going to be my main focus.
moves.14. Bc2 Be6 15. Rf4 Rc8 16. Qe2 b5 17. N: Instead of further protecting the pawn, white goes on an attack that seems quite promising.
moves.17... Nxe4 18. Bxe4 Bxc4 19. Bxh7+: I had calculated variations after Nxe4 and couldn't see any death notes by white, so I continued with exchange.
moves.19... Kxh7 20. Qh5+: Looks menacing, but it does not come to any conclusion. This is a case where one player does not want to defend, and instead acts on the offense. White acted in desperation when there was no need. If the game had continued with a defensive strategy, white would have an uncomfortable game, but he would have drawing chances.
moves.20... Kg8 21. Rh4 f6: The key move in my calculations. After f6, the king can run away to safety. All white's sacrifices have amounted to nothing because of one defensive move. The last game I played with this opponent, he had similar game against me. Maybe he overestimated his chances.

gameName: Unsound Sacrifice to Get Away from Defense
